title: Data file
description: Schema for submitting metadata for a data file.

no_file_available.comment: md5sum is required for all files unless the file is not available from the portal. file_size is required for files present on portal and have one of the statuses: in progress, revoked, archived or released.

paired_with.comment: Only paired-ended files should have paired_with value.

run_type.comment: Only paired-ended files should have paired_end values.

external_accession.comment: A file with an external accession should not get an ENCODE accession.

revoke_detail.comment: Only revoked files can have revoke_detail specified.

mapped_run_type.comment: Only bam files can have mapped_run_type specified.

mapped_read_length.comment: Only bam files can have mapped_read_length specified.

paired_end.comment: Files with paired-end value 2 require a paired_with value and files with paired_end specified require run_type to be specified as paired-ended

output_type.comment: Files with output_type reads and file format fastq, fatsa, csfasta, csqual and sra require read_length to be specified.

file_format.comment: Fastq and sra files require run_type and replicate but should not have assembly. Raw data files require platform to be specified. Processed files require assembly to be specified.

content_error_detail.comment: Specification of status of content error is required if content_error_detail is specified

status.comment: file_size is required in files with statuses in progress, revoked, archived and released unless the file is not available from the portal. content_error_details can be specified in files with status deleted and is required in files with the status content error.

date_created.title: Date created
date_created.decription: The date the object was created.
date_created.comment: Do not submit. The date the object is created is assigned by the server.

alternate_accessions.title: Alternate accessions
alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.
alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.

items.title: Alternate Accession
items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.

external_accession.title: External accession
external_accession.description: For files that were not accessioned at our site but have an accession elsewhere.
external_accession.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.

read_count.title: Read count
read_count.description: Number of reads in fastq file.
read_count.comment: Do not submit. This value is calculated and posted by checkfiles script upon submission.

oneOf.comment: Historical file formats, not valid for new submissions.

file_format_type.title: Specific file format type
file_format_type.description: Files of type bed and gff require further specification

oneOf.comment: Historical file formats, not valid for new submissions.

file_format_specifications.title: File format specifications documents
file_format_specifications.description: Text or .as files the further explain the file format

items.comment: See document.json for a list of available identifiers.

restricted.title: Restricted file
restricted.description: A flag to indicate whether this file is subject to restricted access
restricted.comment: Do not submit. This value can only be set by admins.

no_file_available.title: No file available
no_file_available.description: A flag to indicate whether this file is available to download. It may also not exist if it is the result of an unproductive analysis.
no_file_available.comment: Do not submit. This value can only be set by admins.

submitted_file_name.title: Original file name
submitted_file_name.description: The local file name used at time of submission.
submitted_file_name.comment: Although this is not required. It is highly recommended.

md5sum.title: MD5sum
md5sum.description: The md5sum of the file being transferred.
md5sum.comment: Required for files with no_file_available = false . Warning: This value can vary for files of same content gzipped at different times

content_md5sum.title: Content MD5sum
content_md5sum.description: The MD5sum of the uncompressed file.
content_md5sum.comment: Do not submit. This is only relavant for gzipped files. This value is calculated and posted by checkfiles script upon submission.

fastq_signature.title: Fastq file flowcell based signature
fastq_signature.description: Fastq file flowcell based unique signature to reference a file.
fastq_signature.comment: Do not submit. This value is calculated and posted by checkfiles script upon submission.

items.title: Flowcell based fastq siganture part
items.description: Fastq file flowcell based unique signature to reference a file.
items.comment: Current convention is based on the Illumina unique sequence identifier, colon separated flowcell, lane, read_end(1/2) and barcode.

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: The measurement device used to collect data.
platform.comment: This field is required for csfasta, csqual, rcc, idat and CEL file formats. See platform.json for identifer format.

read_length.title: Read length
read_length.description: For high-throughput sequencing, the number of contiguous nucleotides determined by sequencing.
read_length.comment: This field is required for fastq, fasta, csfasta, csqual and sra file formats containing sequencing reads.

run_type.title: Run type for sequencing files
run_type.description: Indicates if file is part of a single or paired end sequencing run
run_type.comment: This field is required for sra and fastq files.

paired_end.title: Paired End Identifier
paired_end.description: Which read of the pair the file represents (in case of paired end sequencing run)
paired_end.comment: This field is required if run_type is paired-ended.

paired_with.title: File pairing
paired_with.description: The paired end fastq that corresponds with this file.
paired_with.comment: This is required for files with paired_end 2 and is calculated for files with paired_end 1.

mapped_read_length.title: Mapped read length
mapped_read_length.description: The length of the reads actually mapped, if the original read length was clipped.
mapped_read_length.comment: This is used when the original sequenced read length needed to be adjusted to match a replicate, or to match experiments and controls.

mapped_run_type.title: Mapped run type for bam files
mapped_run_type.description: The mapped run type of the alignment file which may differ from the fastqs it is derived from.
mapped_run_type.comment: When the control and experiment run types do not match, one may be changed in order to meet pipeline requirements.

flowcell_details.title: Flowcells
flowcell_details.description: For high-throughput sequencing, the flowcells used for the sequencing of the replicate.

machine.title: Machine Name
machine.description: The lab specific name of the machine used.

barcode_in_read.title: Barcode in read
barcode_in_read.description: The read the barcode is located on.

barcode_position.title: Barcode position
barcode_position.description: The 1-based start position of the barcode in 5->3 orientation.

chunk.title: Chunk
chunk.description: The file chunk label as assigned by Illumina software when splitting up a fastq into specified chunk sizes.
chunk.comment: This label is used to re-assemble the chunks into the original file in the correct order.

output_type.title: Output type
output_type.description: A description of the file's purpose or contents.

enum: minus strand signal of all reads
plus strand signal of all reads
minus strand signal of unique reads
plus strand signal of unique reads

oneOf.comment: Historical output types, not valid for new submissions.

derived_from.title: Derived from
derived_from.description: The files participating as inputs into software to produce this output file.

items.comment: See file.json for a list of available identifiers.

controlled_by.title: Controlled by
controlled_by.description: The files which should be used as a control for this file.
controlled_by.comment: This is used by the pipeline to find ChIP-seq controls.

items.comment: See file.json for a list of available identifiers.

supersedes.title: Supersedes
supersedes.description: The files that this file supersedes.
supersedes.comment: The files in this list should be obsolete and the superseeding file object should be used instead.

items.comment: The files in this list should be archived or revoked.

dataset.title: Dataset
dataset.description: The experiment or dataset the file belongs to.
dataset.comment: Required. See dataset.json for available identifiers.

replicate.title: Replicate
replicate.description: The experimental replicate designation for the file.
replicate.comment: This field is required for sra and fastq files. See replicate.json for available identifiers.

assembly.title: Mapping assembly
assembly.description: Genome assembly that files were mapped to.
assembly.comment: Required property for bam, sam, gtf, gff, bed and bigBed file format files. This property should not be submitted with sra or fastq files.

genome_annotation.title: Genome annotation
genome_annotation.description: Genome annotation that file was generated with.
genome_annotation.comment: Applies to files created using annotations.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the file object.
status.comment: Do not submit.  This is set by admins along the process of file submission.

dbxrefs.title: External identifiers
dbxrefs.description: Identifiers from external resources that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects.
dbxrefs.comment: Do not submit.  This is for admins to make virtual file objects for files at external resources.

items.title: External identifier
items.description: Identifier from an external resource that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects.

step_run.title: Analysis step run
step_run.description: The run instance of the step used to generate the file.
step_run.comment: This may be linked to an individual instance at DNANexus or it may be virtual and have many files linked to it.

content_error_detail.title: Content error detail
content_error_detail.description: Explanation of why the file failed the automated content checks.
content_error_detail.comment: Do not submit.  This is posted by the checkfiles script. It is required when status is 'content error'

revoke_detail.title: Revoke error detail
revoke_detail.description: Explanation of why the file was revoked.
revoke_detail.comment: Do not submit. The field would be posted by DCC.
